Use insects: Insects are important pollinators for many plants. Creating habitats such as gardens and parks can encourage insect life.
Use animals: Some animals such as bats, hummingbirds, and butterflies can help pollinate plants.
Create artificial pollination sites: Man made structures such as pollinator-friendly bridges or tunnels can be used to promote pollinator access.
Use robotics: Automation is growing and becoming more prevalent in many industries, including agriculture. Robotic pollination is being studied as a possible solution.
Use drones: Drones can be modified to release pollen from certain species of flowers. This technology is still in development, but it has great potential.
